result.execSummary:
The defendant Maggie N. Flodeen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 15CF264 and 16CF130 called together at 9:30am [mo]
Defendant Maggie N. Flodeen in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews paperwork submitted by Atty. Rhiel, Ms. Flodeen indicates she needs additional time to think about plea offer. 

recess: 9:34am--reconvene: 9:47am

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Case 15CF264, Count #2 and Case 16CF130, Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Count #1 of Case 15CF264 and uncharged violation for Felony Bail Jumping allegations for violations of SCRAM program/alcohol consumption as a condition of bond in cases 15CF264 and 16CF130 for incidents occurign on or between July 15, 2016 and July 20, 2016

Atty. Rhiel requests a continued date for sentencing
ADA Shock does not object to a continued date for sentencing; but does request that the Court revoke bond pending sentencing.

The Court revokes the signature bond in each case and requires a $10,000 Cash bond to cover both files, with the same non- monetary conditions.
recess: 10:07am--reconvene: 10:21am

Ms. Flodeen indicates that she wishes to proceed to sentencing today.
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Case 15CF264  the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
On Case 16CF130, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

--On Case 15CF264: to serve 45 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence FORTHWITH.
---Ms. Flodeen is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars or taverns or liquor stores
--not to possess or consume any alcohol or illegal drugs
--to pay statutory costs
--to pay $127 in subpoena fees in Case 15CF264
--to pay $33 restitution to the victims mother in Case 15CF264



Days credit for time already served:  1 day as to Case 16CF130
Days credit for time already served: 0 days as to Case 15CF264

recess: 10:54am

Cases 15CF264 & 16CF130 called together at 10:40 am [Clerk SH] 
Defendant Maggie N. Flodeen in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

16CF130:
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Miss Flodeen waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Atty Rhiel requests that 15CF264 be set for trial and set 16CF130 for STC on the FSSC date. 
Court inquires if there is any issue to setting both cases for trial
No objection from either party - if set for two days
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Court informs Miss Flodeen that the FSSC date is the deadline to enter a plea
Recess: 10:45 am

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] cases #15CF264 and #16CF130 called at 9:08am.
Defendant Maggie N. Flodeen in court with Attorney John V Rhiel.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rhiel indicates that the Defense has completed its investigation and that the parties are in the finalizing stages of a plea agreement. 
Attorney Rhiel requests that the case be scheduled for one further status in approximately four weeks; this will allow Ms. Flodeen time to discuss possible case outcome implications with her employer. 
The Court continues Bond.

Defendant Maggie N. Flodeen in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited

Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions:

-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-Take all prescribed medications as ordered
-No contact with AJB 
-No contact with Jillian Smulders, unless she consents in writing, then no discussion
